Description: Here's a 80's era Hondo All-Star H-702 electric guitar in very good plus condition. This was Hondo's version of the Fender Bullet. It has 2 humbucking pickups with volume and tone knobs and a 3-way selector and a coil tap. All the electronics are original and in good working condition. There is some minor buckling of the plastic pickguard (typical). Scale length is 25 and a 1/2 in and 1.700 on nut width with a slab board Rosewood fingerboard. The guitar is hard tail with a string through body. The Finish is a dark stain this clear-coated and not easy to photograph but looks very sharp and person the 4th picture gives a good representation of it. The weight on the guitar is 6 lb 9 oz on my scale. For a guitar built in the early mid eighties it is in very good shape. There is minor nicks and scuffs as to be expected of a guitar of this age. The guitar ships with a period case that has one broken latch but will serve for decent protection. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.
Title: 80's era Hondo All-Star H-702 / Bullet
